Kelly runs back and forth once, and then decides that she doesn't want to run next to Blake, so she starts to run to the 40-yard line and back. She does this 34 times. How much farther does the winner run than the loser?

0.user_question: Blake and Kelly are having a contest to see who can run the most in 15 minutes. They decide to do it on a football field that is 100 yards long. Blake runs back and forth 15 times. Kelly runs back and forth once, and then decides that she doesn't want to run next to Blake, so she starts to run to the 40-yard line and back. She does this 34 times. How much farther does the winner run than the loser?

1.subquestion: How far does one trip (back and forth) count towards running distance?

subanswer.text: One roundtrip along the football field consists of going from the starting point to the other end and coming back; hence it counts toward 100 yards outward plus another 100 yards returning, adding up to 200 yards per single roundtrip. The answer is 200 yards.

subanswer.text: To find out who won, calculate the distances traveled individually first.
